documentType: interview summary or expert consultation notes
summary: This document summarizes a call with Dr. Lisa Rocchio, a clinician, discussing her approach to treating patients with histories of abusive behavior, general principles of perpetrator grooming, and factors affecting victim disclosure. It appears to be part of a legal case preparation, likely for the Epstein or Maxwell proceedings, seeking expert insight on trauma, grooming, and victim psychology.

persons.name: Dr. Lisa Rocchio
persons.context: A clinician consulted to provide expert insight on treating patients with abusive histories, grooming techniques, and victim psychology. She discusses her clinical methods and general knowledge about perpetrator behavior.

events.title: Expert consultation call with Dr. Lisa Rocchio
events.description: A call was conducted with Dr. Lisa Rocchio to discuss clinical approaches to treating patients, perpetrator grooming strategies, and factors related to victim disclosure.

events.title: Planned travel to Italy
events.description: Dr. Lisa Rocchio mentions plans to leave for Italy, with a return date of November 27.

keyFacts: Dr. Lisa Rocchio, a clinician, has treated victims who have themselves engaged in sexually abusive behavior or intimate partner violence, though treating perpetrators is not her specialization.

She describes a clinical approach that relies on patient self-report while probing for inconsistencies, using screening measures, and consulting peers or other experts when presentations are unexpected.
The document outlines general grooming techniques used by perpetrators, such as building false safety through shared interests and gradually escalating deviant behavior to normalize abuse.
The call was likely part of legal case preparation, as evidenced by the request for literature on attachment, grooming, and delayed disclosure, and the document being subject to a protective order.
